item.title: The White Moonlight Disdained by the Male Protagonist of Redemption
item.description:
Ning Yao died tragically.
 The man she had saved and cared for for many years despised her and shattered her spirit veins with his own hands and dissolved her body.
Ning Yao: “Thank you. I have waited for this day.”
Ning Yao is from the ancient Bodhi clan, kind by nature but without a heart.
 One year, she rescued a demon from the hands of the immortal Xuanmen, who was tortured and dying. She took good care of him, curing his years of illness and scars.
 She did not mind his humble status and liked him wholeheartedly, always smiling, hugging, and kissing him.
 Every time at that moment, Feng Jingzhuo felt pity and helplessness, and his love deepened.
 Little Bodhi (Ning Yao) cured his disabled and ugly body and cured his inferiority, self-loathing, sensitivity, and paranoia.
 How could he not be infatuated and loyal and love her deeply?
 But what Feng Jingzhuo did not know was that according to the rules of the Bodhi clan’s ascension, one must first save others to prove the truth and then die and be reborn before ascending.
 And Ning Yao’s lifelong wish is to ascend.
That year, the eldest sister failed to ascend to heaven, and before she and her brother-in-law retired to the world sweetly, she pointed out a clear path for Ning Yao:

“Yao Yao, our Bodhi clan is too beloved. Who could bear to use us as a stepping stone for enlightenment?”

“If you’re truly set on it, why not try that demon imprisoned by the immortal sect? Pfft—those fools don’t know his worth. He’s from the Cangyuan Dragon Clan.”

“If it works, great. If not… well, you could always fall in love, just like I did.”

Her elder sister revealed a secret about the Cangyuan Dragon Clan:

If they fall deeply enough in love, their hearts will grow scales to shield them from their emotions. When that happens, their instincts will turn against their beloved, giving rise to an uncontrollable urge to kill.

Slay one’s beloved, attain enlightenment, ascend immediately, and forget the past.

A perfect outcome for both.

Ning Yao knew that Feng Jingzhuo had already begun to grow his heart’s scales.

Yet, he endured the agonizing pain, hiding away to claw open his own chest. He ripped out the endlessly growing scales, pinned his own hands down with bone nails—desperately resisting his dragon instincts.

“Yao Yao, don’t come in…”

“I beg you… whatever you do, don’t come in…”

“It’ll be over soon. Be good. Stay outside…”

Outside, Ning Yao pondered, if we can both ascend, that’s better than neither of us ascending at all.

So, she went in.

Just as she always did, she held him in her arms, kissing his trembling, pale lips with tenderness.

After many 10 thousand years, Ning Yao was reborn and successfully ascended.

She forgot Feng Jingzhou, but he remembered her.

Tormenting himself, he wanted to turn back time.

Ning Yao was very happy, but the ceremony of conferring the gods was a little simple.

Because the entire world of gods was busy trying to stop a fallen god who wants to activate the forbidden Time-Reversal Array.

Theme: My heart is controlled by me, not by heavens.

item.title: Transmigrated Into an Ancient Famine Novel as a Scumbag Alpha (ABO, GL)
item.description:
Ye Qing wakes up to find herself transported into an ancient famine novel, becoming a shameless rogue. During a famine, the original host scams food and drink in the city, committing all sorts of evil deeds. With an innocent and harmless face, she tricks the distressed Jiang Jinhuang into marrying her. After the marriage, the original host’s true nature is revealed. When Jiang Jinhuang refuses to consummate the marriage, the host relentlessly pressures and torments her, even nearly strangling Jiang Jinhuang’s younger sister to death. After enduring countless hardships, Jiang Jinhuang finally returns to the capital, where her family and childhood friend deal with the original host, whose final destination is a mass grave outside the city.

Ye Qing, having received the entire plot, plans to stay far away from Jiang Jinhuang and live well in this ancient world. But just as she prepares to leave, her personal system activates, unlocking the spatial ability from her previous life. Unlike before, her space now includes land and a spiritual spring. The system tells her that by earning Jiang Jinhuang’s favor, she can gain rewards to ensure she won’t starve during the famine.

Jiang Jinhuang’s favor +1, rewarded with 10 potato seeds;
Jiang Jinhuang’s favor +1, rewarded with a 2-pound carp;
Jiang Jinhuang’s favor +1, rewarded with 10 eggs…

Through her efforts, Ye Qing helps Jiang Jinhuang and her sister thrive during the famine. When she successfully escorts Jiang Jinhuang back to the capital and prepares to leave alone, Jiang Jinhuang’s eyes redden with tears.

Jiang Jinhuang, the daughter of the Minister of Rites, is separated from her family during a visit to Linzhou when they are scattered by rioters. After many struggles, she reaches Linzhou but fails to find her relatives. Lost and desperate, she believes Ye Qing’s words and temporarily marries her. However, after the marriage, Ye Qing becomes a different person, constantly abusing her. Then, one day, Ye Qing suddenly changes for the better, protecting Jiang Jinhuang and her sister, ensuring they never go hungry. Later, Ye Qing even escorts them back to the capital. When Ye Qing tries to leave, Jiang Jinhuang blocks the door, her fox-like eyes staring at Ye Qing with an unreadable expression, saying, “Where do you think you’re going, abandoning me?”

|Qianyuan = Alpha, Kunze = Omega, Zhongyong = Beta|

Content Tags: Personal Space, Sweet Story, Book Transmigration, Feel-Good Story, ABO, Stockpiling

One-Sentence Summary: Living well and eating heartily in a famine novel~

Theme: Change your fate through effort and gain a positive life.

item.title: Within The Sound of Swallows
item.description:
At the tender age of five, Shen Guiyan could recite the Thousand Character Classic from memory; at the age of six, she could already play guqin and even composed her own melodies; at the age of seven, she could write a full poem and finish it in the brief time it took for the incense stick to burn; and by the time she turned eight, she was already betrothed to the son of the Prime Minister.

Everyone said that she was born with Phoenix Jade* in her mouth— destined for greatness from the very start.

However, fate took a cruel turn.

A woman from the modern era arrived and transformed Shen Guiyan’s once-brash younger sister into someone sharp and clever. She stole her fiancé, harmed her birth mother, and ruthlessly pulled her down from the heavens. Laughing arrogantly, she sneered, “How can a mere woman from the feudal era ever compete with a modern woman of the 21st century?”

Schemes and trickery altered her predestined fate, a pregnant belly destroyed her marriage prospects, and she was forced to marry a spoiled and troublemaking son of a noble, who brought ruin upon her on her supposed wedding night. And yet, by some strange twist of fate, it inadvertently led her to the most extraordinary encounter with her fated one.

A crazy monk once read her fortune: a great calamity at the coming of age, a great joy at the age of twenty, and a great sorrow in old age.

Shen Guiyan did not believe in fate. She only believed that with human determination, one could even overcome destiny.

Those who took from her, she would make sure they would pay! Those who harmed her, she would make sure they would burn in the pits of hell!

So what if you have traveled through time? So what if you have been reborn?

Even if you have eight or ten golden fingers**, I would chop them all up for you!

I would be coming for you, no matter what!

*born with Phoenix Jade in her mouth – this symbolizes a noble or auspicious birth, often implying destiny, luck, or even divine favor.

**golden fingers – Chinese slang for cheat-like powers, or supernatural advantages

item.title: Within The Sound of Swallows
item.description:
At the tender age of five, Shen Guiyan could recite the Thousand Character Classic from memory; at the age of six, she could already play guqin and even composed her own melodies; at the age of seven, she could write a full poem and finish it in the brief time it took for the incense stick to burn; and by the time she turned eight, she was already betrothed to the son of the Prime Minister.

Everyone said that she was born with Phoenix Jade* in her mouth— destined for greatness from the very start.

However, fate took a cruel turn.

A woman from the modern era arrived and transformed Shen Guiyan’s once-brash younger sister into someone sharp and clever. She stole her fiancé, harmed her birth mother, and ruthlessly pulled her down from the heavens. Laughing arrogantly, she sneered, “How can a mere woman from the feudal era ever compete with a modern woman of the 21st century?”

Schemes and trickery altered her predestined fate, a pregnant belly destroyed her marriage prospects, and she was forced to marry a spoiled and troublemaking son of a noble, who brought ruin upon her on her supposed wedding night. And yet, by some strange twist of fate, it inadvertently led her to the most extraordinary encounter with her fated one.

A crazy monk once read her fortune: a great calamity at the coming of age, a great joy at the age of twenty, and a great sorrow in old age.

Shen Guiyan did not believe in fate. She only believed that with human determination, one could even overcome destiny.

Those who took from her, she would make sure they would pay! Those who harmed her, she would make sure they would burn in the pits of hell!

So what if you have traveled through time? So what if you have been reborn?

Even if you have eight or ten golden fingers**, I would chop them all up for you!

I would be coming for you, no matter what!

*born with Phoenix Jade in her mouth – this symbolizes a noble or auspicious birth, often implying destiny, luck, or even divine favor.

**golden fingers – Chinese slang for cheat-like powers, or supernatural advantages
